issue.title: Build fails on arm64: error: use of undeclared identifier 'ID_AA64ISAR0_SHA3_BASE'
issue.body:
```
/wrkdirs/usr/ports/security/liboqs/work/liboqs-fd9f2fa/src/common/common.c:99:19: warning: use of GNU statement expression extension [-Wgnu-statement-expression]
        uint64_t isar0 = READ_SPECIALREG(id_aa64isar0_el1);
                         ^
/usr/include/machine/armreg.h:60:2: note: expanded from macro 'READ_SPECIALREG'
({      uint64_t _val;                                                  \
 ^
/wrkdirs/usr/ports/security/liboqs/work/liboqs-fd9f2fa/src/common/common.c:106:38: error: use of undeclared identifier 'ID_AA64ISAR0_SHA3_BASE'
        if (ID_AA64ISAR0_SHA3_VAL(isar0) >= ID_AA64ISAR0_SHA3_BASE) {
                                            ^
/wrkdirs/usr/ports/security/liboqs/work/liboqs-fd9f2fa/src/common/common.c:109:6: warning: implicit declaration of function 'ID_AA64ISAR0_AdvSIMD_VAL' is invalid in C99 [-Wimplicit-function-declaration]
        if (ID_AA64ISAR0_AdvSIMD_VAL(isar0) >= ID_AA64ISAR0_AdvSIMD_BASE) {
            ^
/wrkdirs/usr/ports/security/liboqs/work/liboqs-fd9f2fa/src/common/common.c:109:41: error: use of undeclared identifier 'ID_AA64ISAR0_AdvSIMD_BASE'; did you mean 'ID_AA64ISAR0_AdvSIMD_VAL'?
        if (ID_AA64ISAR0_AdvSIMD_VAL(isar0) >= ID_AA64ISAR0_AdvSIMD_BASE) {
                                               ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
                                               ID_AA64ISAR0_AdvSIMD_VAL
/wrkdirs/usr/ports/security/liboqs/work/liboqs-fd9f2fa/src/common/common.c:109:6: note: 'ID_AA64ISAR0_AdvSIMD_VAL' declared here
        if (ID_AA64ISAR0_AdvSIMD_VAL(isar0) >= ID_AA64ISAR0_AdvSIMD_BASE) {
            ^
/wrkdirs/usr/ports/security/liboqs/work/liboqs-fd9f2fa/src/common/common.c:109:38: warning: ordered comparison between pointer and integer ('int' and 'int (*)()')
        if (ID_AA64ISAR0_AdvSIMD_VAL(isar0) >= ID_AA64ISAR0_AdvSIMD_BASE) {
            ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ^  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
3 warnings and 2 errors generated.
```

Rev. fd9f2fa from branch ```jg-freebsd-cpu-features```
FreeBSD 13.1
